Class GenAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • amesmarket.GenAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    uchicago.src.sim.gui.Drawable

    public class GenAgent
extends java.lang.Object
implements uchicago.src.sim.gui.Drawable
    GenCo - a wholesale power producer.

    Example showing what genData[i] contains

    GenData
    ID atBus FCost A B CapMin CapMax initMoney
    1 1 5 15 0.10 0 100 1000

      • isCanary

        public boolean isCanary()
        Whether or not the generator is a 'canary' that is used to indicate the load was too much for the standard generators. This is a simple way to deal with the lack of reserve problem.

      • addActualDispatch

        public void addActualDispatch(int day,
                              double[] dispatchLevels)
        Put the 'actual', that is realtime computed dispatch for the GenCo.
        Parameters:
        day - actual day number
        dispatchLevels - dispatch for each hour, 0 to 23.

      • addCommitmentForDay

        public void addCommitmentForDay(int d,
                                int[] commitment)
        Put the commitment for day d. This stores the commitment by day d, but the values are generated by the SCUC/DAM on day d-1. In otherwords, if we are running the DAM on day d, add commitment for d+1.
        Parameters:
        d -
        commitment -

      • getUnitOnT0State

        public int getUnitOnT0State(int day)
        On/off Status for T0, day d. From the pyomo model:
        if positive, the number of hours prior to (and including) t=0 that the unit has been on. if negative, the number of hours prior to (and including) t=0 that the unit has been off. the value cannot be 0, by definition.
        Parameters:
        day -
        Returns:
        The on/off is whether or not the unit was on/off on the last hour of day-1, or, 1, if the generator does not have a record for day d-1.
